VAR_DESC: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) station number
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Water Information System (NWIS) database
Method_Desc: Extracted from the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Water Information System (NWIS) database, May 2, 2016

VAR_DESC: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) station number preceded with a "T"
SOURCE_DATA: Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project database
Method_Desc: Extracted from the Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project Database, May 2, 2016

VAR_DESC: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) station name (short version)
SOURCE_DATA: Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project database
Method_Desc: Extracted from the Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project Database, May 2, 2016

VAR_DESC: RSQA study in which the sampling site is located
SOURCE_DATA: Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project database
Method_Desc: n/a

VAR_DESC: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) station name
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Water Information System (NWIS) database
Notes: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) station names are a unique location description for the station number and identify water source in relation to another water source, road, or town.
Method_Desc: Extracted from the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Water Information System (NWIS) database, May 2, 2016

VAR_DESC: Latitude of the water-quality (QW) sampling location (may be different than NWIS)
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Water Information System (NWIS) database; Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project
Notes: For MSQA and SESQA studies, values are from NWIS (usually gage locations); for NESQA, PNSQA, and CSQA, values are from the location of water-quality sampling
Method_Desc: Extracted from the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Water Information System (NWIS) database, May 2, 2016 OR determined by Global Positioning System (GPS) at the location of water-quality sampling.

VAR_DESC: Longitude of the water-quality (QW) sampling location (may be different than NWIS)
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Water Information System (NWIS) database; Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project
Notes: For MSQA and SESQA studies, values are from NWIS (usually gage locations); for NESQA, PNSQA, and CSQA, values are from the location of water-quality sampling
Method_Desc: Extracted from the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) National Water Information System (NWIS) database, May 2, 2016 OR determined by Global Positioning System (GPS) at the location of water-quality sampling.

VAR_DESC: The "Combined Statistical Area" in which the site is located
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. Census Bureau, combined statistical areas
METHOD_SIR2012_5194: Spatial join with points and polygons

VAR_DESC: The closest large urban center based on the Combined Statistical Area
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. Census Bureau, combined statistical areas
METHOD_SIR2012_5194: Spatial join with points and polygons combined with visual assignement in selected cases

VAR_DESC: Area of watershed draining to the water-chemistry site, derived from a GIS
SOURCE_DATA: GIS calculated
Method_Desc: Extracted from the attribute table of the watershed boundaries shapefile ("RSQAWatersheds.shp")

VAR_DESC: The length of the digitized reach from which the riparian zone buffers were created (defined as Log10 of the watershed area)
SOURCE_DATA: Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project
Notes: The length of the digitized riparian reach, represented by this variable, differs from the length of the sampled ecological reach. This riparian reach was digitized from imagery, starting from the most downstream end of the sampled ecological reach. The length of this digitized reach is equal to the base-10 logarithm of the watershed area of the water-quality site.
Method_Desc: Extracted from the attribute table of the riparian-zone boundaries shapefile ("RSQARiparianZones.shp")

VAR_DESC: Elevation at the water-chemistry site
SOURCE_DATA: National Elevation Dataset, 30-m , included in NHDPlus V2
References: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and U.S. Geological Survey, 2012
Method_Desc: The locations of the sites were intersected with the elevation dataset to determine the elevation at the site.

VAR_DESC: Level 3 Ecoregions classification code at the water-chemistry site
SOURCE_DATA: USEPA Ecoregions Level 3 Ecoregions
Notes: Ecoregion boundaries in the U.S. are updated periodically.
Method_Desc: The locations of the water-chemistry sites were intersected with the ecoregions dataset to determine the ecoregions classification at the site.

VAR_DESC: Level 3 Ecoregions name at the water-chemistry site
SOURCE_DATA: USEPA Ecoregions Level 3 Ecoregions
Notes: Ecoregion boundaries in the U.S. are updated periodically.
Method_Desc: The locations of the water-chemistry sites were intersected with the ecoregions dataset to determine the ecoregions classification at the site.

VAR_DESC: Latitude of the Eco sampling location
SOURCE_DATA: Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project
Notes: Values are from the most downstream transect (6 total transects along reach) where ecological data were collected
Method_Desc: Determined by GPS at the most downstream location of ecological sampling.

VAR_DESC: Longitude of the Eco sampling location
SOURCE_DATA: Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project
Notes: Values are from the most downstream transect (6 total transects along reach) where ecological data were collected
Method_Desc: Determined by GPS at the most downstream location of ecological sampling.

VAR_DESC: Developed-high intensity, from NLCD 2011-class 24
SOURCE_DATA: National Land Cover Dataset (NLCD)
References: Homer and others, 2015; U.S. Geological Survey, 2014a; Ministry of Forests, Lands, Natural Resource Operations and Rural Development, 2014
Notes: For these two watersheds (12212001 and 12212450), land-cover data was downloaded from British Columbia and are included in NLCD11 land-cover percentages for those watersheds.
Method_Desc: Determined the number of grid cells classified as "developed, high intensity" in the watershed, divided this number by the number of 30-m resolution grid cells in the watershed, then multiplied the quotient by 100.

VAR_DESC: Final Land Use category, usually LU_cat_calc but occasionally overriden based on Google Earth review; with added "Hydro" category for SESQA
SOURCE_DATA: Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project
Method_Desc: Calculated using selected NWALT 2012 variables (see metadata Process_Steps for this variable for details)

VAR_DESC: Major land-use category
SOURCE_DATA: Regional Stream Quality Assessment (RSQA) Project
Method_Desc: Calculated using selected NWALT 2012 variables (see metadata Process_Steps for this variable for details)

VAR_DESC: Total area of golf courses
SOURCE_DATA: ESRI USA Landmarks
Method_Desc: Calculated the total area of golf course polygons within each watershed boundary

VAR_DESC: Mean year of urban development based on the formula: =IF(UrbanAge_PCT_NonUrban <100,(((2005*UrbanAge_PCT_2010) + (1995* UrbanAge_PCT_2000) + (1985* UrbanAge_PCT_1990) + (1975* UrbanAge_PCT_1980) + (1965* UrbanAge_PCT_1970) + (1955* UrbanAge_PCT_1960) + (1945* UrbanAge_PCT_1950) + (1935* UrbanAge_PCT_1940))/(100- UrbanAge_PCT_NonUrban)),0)
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. national mapping of the year of “first development” for urban areas, 1940-2010
Method_Desc: Determined the mean age of urbanization based on weighting the percentage of each decade for each watershed and calculating the mean decade of development.

VAR_DESC: Year of "first development" of urban land use 1940
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. national mapping of the year of “first development” for urban areas, 1940-2010
Method_Desc: Determined the number of cells classified as "1940" within each watershed, divided this number by the number of 100-m resolution grid cells in the watershed, then multiplied the quotient by 100.

VAR_DESC: Year of "first development" of urban land use 1950
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. national mapping of the year of “first development” for urban areas, 1940-2010
Method_Desc: Determined the number of cells classified as "1950" within each watershed, divided this number by the number of 100-m resolution grid cells in the watershed, then multiplied the quotient by 100.

VAR_DESC: Year of "first development" of urban land use 1960
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. national mapping of the year of “first development” for urban areas, 1940-2010
Method_Desc: Determined the number of cells classified as "1960" within each watershed, divided this number by the number of 100-m resolution grid cells in the watershed, then multiplied the quotient by 100.

VAR_DESC: Year of "first development" of urban land use 1970
SOURCE_DATA: U.S. national mapping of the year of “first development” for urban areas, 1940-2010
Method_Desc: Determined the number of cells classified as "1970" within each watershed, divided this number by the number of 100-m resolution grid cells in the watershed, then multiplied the quotient by 100.

VAR_DESC: Dam density, from an enhanced version of the 2009 National Inventory of Dams (NID), created in December 2010; number per 100 square kilometers
SOURCE_DATA: USACE NID (National Inventory of Dams) 2009 (83,000 records) merged with verified/corrected locations for 59,000 from USGS National Map/NHD work
References: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, 2010; Falcone, J.A., 2011

VAR_DESC: Dam storage ("NID_STORAGE"), from an enhanced version of the 2009 National Inventory of Dams (NID), created in December 2010; megaliters total storage per square kilometers (1 megaliters = 1,000,000 liters = 1,000 cubic meters).
SOURCE_DATA: USACE NID (National Inventory of Dams) 2009 (83,000 records) merged with ve
References: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, 2010; Falcone, J.A., 2011

Method_Desc: Intersected dam locations with watersheds; determined the total storage (attribute "NID_STORAGE" from the National Inventory of Dams Dataset) of dams in the watershed; converted the acre-feet units to megaliters by multiplying by 1.2334818553, then divided the total storage expressed in megaliters by the area of the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Base flow index, a ratio of base flow to total streamflow
SOURCE_DATA: Base-flow index grid for the conterminous United States
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of base-flow index grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean percentage of Dunne overland flow, also known as saturation overland flow in total streamflow, expressed as a percentage and ranging from 0 to 100.
SOURCE_DATA: Base-flow index grid for the conterminous United States
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the overland flow (calculated using the Dunne method) grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean percentage of Horton overland flow, also known as infiltration-excess overland flow
SOURCE_DATA: Base-flow index grid for the conterminous United States
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the overland flow (calculated using the Horton method) grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean Index of subsurface flow contact time expressed in days (residence time).
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of contact time grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean annual runoff for water year 2013 (Oct 1, 2012 to Sept 30, 2013)
SOURCE_DATA: USGS WaterWatch, Runoff by Huc8
Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of runoff 2013 grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean annual runoff for water year 2014 (Oct 1, 2013 to Sept 30, 2014)
SOURCE_DATA: USGS WaterWatch, Runoff by Huc8
Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of runoff 2014 grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean annual runoff for water year 2015 (Oct 1, 2014 to Sept 30, 2015)
SOURCE_DATA: USGS WaterWatch, Runoff by Huc8
Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of runoff 2015 grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean annual runoff for water year 2016 (Oct 1, 2015 to Sept 30, 2016)
SOURCE_DATA: USGS WaterWatch, Runoff by Huc8
Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of runoff 2016 grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean annual runoff for water year 2017 (Oct 1, 2016 to Sept 30, 2017)
SOURCE_DATA: USGS WaterWatch, Runoff by Huc8
Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of runoff 2017 grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Percentage of total streams coded as "Stream/River: Hydrographic Category = Ephermeral" (Fcode = 46007)
SOURCE_DATA: NHD High Resolution (1:24,000-scale)
Method_Desc: Clipped the hydrography to the watershed boundary; added up the lengths of the resulting stream segments with a Fcode = 46007 within the watershed, then divided the total length by the watershed area.
METHOD_TOOLS: Clip_analysis; AddGeometryAttributes_management; JoinField_management; AddField_managment; CalculateField_management (MSQA, SESQA); TabulateIntersection_analysis (NESQA, PNSQA, and CSQA)

VAR_DESC: Percentage of total streams coded as "Stream/River: Hydrographic Category = Intermittent" (Fcode = 46003)
SOURCE_DATA: NHD High Resolution (1:24,000-scale)
Method_Desc: Clipped the hydrography to the watershed boundary; added up the lengths of the resulting stream segments with a Fcode = 46003 within the watershed, then divided the total length by the watershed area.
METHOD_TOOLS: Clip_analysis; AddGeometryAttributes_management; JoinField_management; AddField_managment; CalculateField_management (MSQA, SESQA); TabulateIntersection_analysis (NESQA, PNSQA, and CSQA)

VAR_DESC: Percentage of total streams coded as "Stream/River: Hydrographic Category = Perennial" (Fcode = 46006)
SOURCE_DATA: NHD High Resolution (1:24,000-scale)
Method_Desc: Clipped the hydrography to the watershed boundary; added up the lengths of the resulting stream segments with a Fcode = 46006 within the watershed, then divided the total length by the watershed area.
METHOD_TOOLS: Clip_analysis; AddGeometryAttributes_management; JoinField_management; AddField_managment; CalculateField_management (MSQA, SESQA); TabulateIntersection_analysis (NESQA, PNSQA, and CSQA)

VAR_DESC: Percentage of total streams coded as "Stream/River: Hydrographic Category = StreamRiver" (Fcode = 46000)
SOURCE_DATA: NHD High Resolution (1:24,000-scale)
Method_Desc: Clipped the hydrography to the watershed boundary; added up the lengths of the resulting stream segments with a Fcode = 46000 within the watershed, then divided the total length by the watershed area.
METHOD_TOOLS: Clip_analysis; AddGeometryAttributes_management; JoinField_management; AddField_managment; CalculateField_management (MSQA, SESQA); TabulateIntersection_analysis (NESQA, PNSQA, and CSQA)

VAR_DESC: Stream Density
SOURCE_DATA: NHD High Resolution (1:24,000-scale)
Method_Desc: Clipped the hydrography to the watershed boundary; added up the lengths of the resulting stream segments within the watershed, then divided the total length by the watershed area.

VAR_DESC: Mean Topographic wetness index, ln(a/S); where "ln" is the natural log, "a" is the upslope area per unit contour length and "S" is the slope at that point
SOURCE_DATA: TOPMODEL (watershed model)
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of topographic wetness index grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean atmospheric (wet) deposition of total inorganic nitrogen from nitrate, 2013
SOURCE_DATA: National Atmospheric Deposition Program, National Trends Network dataset
Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of grid cells within the watershed for 2013 data.

VAR_DESC: Mean atmospheric (wet) deposition of total inorganic nitrogen from nitrate, 2014
SOURCE_DATA: National Atmospheric Deposition Program, National Trends Network dataset
Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of grid cells within the watershed for 2014 data.

VAR_DESC: Mean atmospheric (wet) deposition of total inorganic nitrogen from nitrate, 2015
SOURCE_DATA: National Atmospheric Deposition Program, National Trends Network dataset
Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of grid cells within the watershed for 2015 data.

VAR_DESC: Mean atmospheric (wet) deposition of total inorganic nitrogen from nitrate, 2016
SOURCE_DATA: National Atmospheric Deposition Program, National Trends Network dataset

VAR_DESC: Mean atmospheric (wet) deposition of total inorganic nitrogen from nitrate, 2017

Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of grid cells within the watershed for 2017 data.

VAR_DESC: Estimated 2012 nitrogen input from farm fertilizer from agricultural land
SOURCE_DATA: County-Level Estimates of Nitrogen and Phosphorus from Commercial Fertilizer, 1987-2012
Method_Desc: County farm fertilizer was apportioned (area-weighted by the portion that intersected with the watershed) to mapped land classified as cultivated crops or pasture/hay from the National Land Cover Database 2011 (This land-cover-weighted areal interpolation method is described in Nakagaki and others, 2013).

VAR_DESC: Estimated 2012 nitrogen input from non-farm fertilizer from urban land
SOURCE_DATA: County-Level Estimates of Nitrogen and Phosphorus from Commercial Fertilizer, 1987-2012
Method_Desc: County non-farm fertilizer was apportioned (area-weighted by the portion that intersected with the watershed) to mapped land classified as developed from the National Land Cover Database 2011 (This land-cover-weighted areal interpolation method is described in Nakagaki and others, 2013).

VAR_DESC: Estimated 2012 nitrogen input from manure from agricultural land
SOURCE_DATA: County-level estimates of nitrogen and phosphorus from animal manure
Method_Desc: County manure was apportioned (area-weighted by the portion that intersected with the watershed) to mapped land classified as cultivated crops or pasture/hay from the National Land Cover Database 2011 (This land-cover-weighted areal interpolation method is described in Nakagaki and others, 2013).

VAR_DESC: Estimated total nitrogen load in permitted wastewater discharge, 1992
SOURCE_DATA: USEPA NPDES (National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)
References: Maupin and Ivahnenko, 2011; Robertson and Saad, 2013
Method_Desc: Intersected facility locations with watersheds; determined the total nitrogen load in the wastewater in the watershed; divided the total by the area of the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Estimated total nitrogen load in permitted wastewater discharge, 1997
SOURCE_DATA: USEPA NPDES (National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)
References: Maupin and Ivahnenko, 2011; Robertson and Saad, 2013
Method_Desc: Intersected facility locations with watersheds; determined the total nitrogen load in the wastewater in the watershed; divided the total by the area of the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Estimated total nitrogen load in permitted wastewater discharge, 2002
SOURCE_DATA: USEPA NPDES (National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)
References: Maupin and Ivahnenko, 2011; Robertson and Saad, 2013
Method_Desc: Intersected facility locations with watersheds; determined the total nitrogen load in the wastewater in the watershed; divided the total by the area of the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Estimated total nitrogen load in 2012 (includes ALL major facilities and only minor waste-water treatment facilities)
SOURCE_DATA: USEPA NPDES (National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)
Method_Desc: Intersected facility locations with watersheds; determined the total nitrogen load from all facilities in the watershed; divided the total by the area of the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Number of permitted facilities in 2012 (includes ALL major facilities and only minor waste-water treatment facilities)
SOURCE_DATA: USEPA NPDES (National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)
Method_Desc: Intersected NPDES facility locations with watersheds; determined the total number of facilities in the watershed

VAR_DESC: Number of permitted facilities considered a "major" producer, 2012 (includes ALL major facilities and only minor waste-water treatment facilities)
SOURCE_DATA: USEPA NPDES (National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)
Method_Desc: Intersected NPDES facility (identified as "Major") locations with watersheds; determined the total number of facilities in the watershed

SOURCE_DATA: USEPA NPDES (National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System)
References: Maupin and Ivahnenko, 2011; Robertson and Saad, 2013

VAR_DESC: Total nitrogen: sum of (N_AtmosphDeposXXXX/.01) + (N_FertFarm2012/BasinGIS_km2) + (N_FertNonFarm2012/BasinGIS_km2) + (N_Manure2012/BasinGIS_km2); where XXXX in the atmospheric deposition term is for the year of sampling
TEMPORAL: 2012 and year of sampling for atmospheric deposition value
SOURCE_DATA: National Atmospheric Deposition Program; County-Level Estimates of Nitrogen and Phosphorus from Commercial Fertilizer; County-level estimates of nitrogen and phosphorus from animal manure
References: NADP, 2017; Brakebill and Gronberg, 2017; Gronberg and Arnold, 2017
Method_Desc: Sum of total nitrogen for farm/non-farm/ and manure sources (see VAR_DESC for details)

VAR_DESC: Total phosphorus: sum of (P_FertFarm2012/BasinGIS_km2) + (P_FertNonFarm2012/BasinGIS_km2) + (P_Manure2012/BasinGIS_km2)
SOURCE_DATA: County-Level Estimates of Nitrogen and Phosphorus from Commercial Fertilizer; County-level estimates of nitrogen and phosphorus from animal manure
References: Brakebill and Gronberg, 2017; Gronberg and Arnold, 2017
Method_Desc: Sum of total phosphorus for farm/non-farm/ and manure sources (see VAR_DESC for details)

VAR_DESC: Mean cost-of-living adjusted household income
SOURCE_DATA: Conterminous U.S. mapping of household income at the block group scale adjusted for cost-of-living for the period 2013-2014
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of adjusted household income grid cells within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean housing unit density, 2000
SOURCE_DATA: <YEAR> housing density and polygons of block-group boundaries (U.S. Census Bureau, 2012) compiled by Geolytics, Inc.
Method_Desc: The values of the housing density grid cells within the watershed were averaged to determine the mean housing density.

VAR_DESC: Mean housing unit density, 2010
SOURCE_DATA: <YEAR> housing density and polygons of block-group boundaries (U.S. Census Bureau, 2012) compiled by Geolytics, Inc.
Method_Desc: The values of the housing density grid cells within the watershed were averaged to determine the mean housing density.

VAR_DESC: Mean population density, 1990
SOURCE_DATA: <YEAR> housing density and polygons of block-group boundaries (U.S. Census Bureau, 2012) compiled by Geolytics, Inc.
Method_Desc: The values of the population density grid cells within the watershed were averaged to determine the mean population density.

VAR_DESC: Mean population density, 2000
SOURCE_DATA: <YEAR> housing density and polygons of block-group boundaries (U.S. Census Bureau, 2012) compiled by Geolytics, Inc.

VAR_DESC: Mean population density, 2010
SOURCE_DATA: <YEAR> housing density and polygons of block-group boundaries (U.S. Census Bureau, 2012) compiled by Geolytics, Inc.
Method_Desc: The values of the population density grid cells within the watershed were averaged to determine the mean population density.

VAR_DESC: Road density, km of roads per square kilometer of watershed
SOURCE_DATA: Census TIGER/Line roads 2013
Notes: Data were downloaded for various years corresponding to the time period of each study
Method_Desc: After clipping the roads layer to the watershed boundary, the total length of the road segments within the watershed was calculated then divided by the watershed area.

VAR_DESC: Mean depth to water table, in feet
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted depth to water grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean available water capacity, inches of water per inches of soil depth
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted available water capacity grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean bulk density, grams per cubic centimeter
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted bulk density grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean Soil Erodibility Factor "K factor" of Universal Soil Equation), of upper most soil horizon (includes rock fragments)
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted K-factor of the uppermost horizon grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean organic matter, in percent by weight
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted organic matter grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean permeability, in inches/hour
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted permeability grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean percentage sand content
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted sand content grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean percentage silt content
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted silt content grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean percentage clay content
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted clay content grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean annual "rainfall erosivity" (R of the Universal Soil Loss Equation), for the period 1971-2000
UNITS: hundreds of foot-tons-force inches per hour per acre per year
SOURCE_DATA: PRISM Climate Group
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the R-factor grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean annual soil loss per unit area ("A"of the Revised Universal Soil Loss Equation)
SOURCE_DATA: David M Wolock (USGS)
Notes: More information about the RUSLE methodology can be found here: http://www.iwr.msu.edu/rusle/
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the soil-loss factor grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean soil thickness, in inches
SOURCE_DATA: STATSGO version 1
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted clay content grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean soil restrictive layer in agricultural land only, with a soil depth of 25cm, in percent
SOURCE_DATA: Nakagaki and others
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the mean weighted depth to bedrock grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean watershed elevation
SOURCE_DATA: National Elevation Dataset, 30-m, included in NHDPlus Version 2
References: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and U.S. Geological Survey, 2012
Method_Desc: Determined the mean value of the elevation grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Mean watershed slope
SOURCE_DATA: National Elevation Dataset, 30-m, included in NHDPlus Version 2
References: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and U.S. Geological Survey, 2012
Method_Desc: Created a slope raster from the NED elevation raster included in the NHDPlus V2 Dataset, then determined the mean value of the slope grid cell values within the watershed.

VAR_DESC: Number of chemicals released in 2010 according to the Toxic Release Inventory (TRI) Program database
SOURCE_DATA: EPA Toxic Release Inventory
References: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, 2010
Method_Desc: Intersected locations of facilities tracked in the Toxic Release Inventory program with watersheds; determined the total number of reported chemicals released from all facilities in the watershed

VAR_DESC: Number of facilities within the TRI dataset according to the Toxic Release Inventory (TRI) Program database
SOURCE_DATA: EPA Toxic Release Inventory
References: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, 2010
Method_Desc: Intersected locations of facilities tracked in the Toxic Release Inventory program with watersheds; determined the total number of reported chemicals released from all facilities in the watershed

VAR_DESC: Number of Superfund sites within the TRI dataset according to the Toxic Release Inventory (TRI) Program database
SOURCE_DATA: EPA Toxic Release Inventory
References: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, 2010
Method_Desc: Intersected locations of superfund sites tracked in the Toxic Release Inventory program with watersheds; determined the total number of sites in the watershed

VAR_DESC: Total pounds of all chemicals released in 2010 according to the Toxic Release Inventory (TRI) Program database
SOURCE_DATA: EPA Toxic Release Inventory
References: U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, 2010
Method_Desc: Intersected locations of facilities tracked in the Toxic Release Inventory program with watersheds; determined the total amount of reported chemicals released from all facilities in the watershed
